metadata.title: CASE 050/04: Alleged Misappropriation of Funds – Manager
metadata.primary_source: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo

overview: The investigation focuses on administrative irregularities concerning insurance coverage procurement at Pristina Airport between 2001 and 2003, which may have led to misuse of public funds.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Finance Administration Instruction on Public Procurement using Kosovo Consolidated Funds

methodology.description: Investigative methods included reviewing comprehensive documentation and analyzing procurement procedures.
documents_reviewed: Documents from Public Enterprise Airport Pristina

background.context: The investigation pertains to misappropriation involving insurance procurement irregularities at Pristina Airport.
entities_involved: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo
timeline: 2004-04-01: Commencement of new insurance coverage by Insurance Company 2

investigation_details.subject: Alleged misappropriation of funds by Pristina Airport Manager

allegations.description: Failure to invite international tenders for insurance coverage during 2002-2003.
allegations.findings: The Manager concluded the contract without a tender process, violating procurement regulations.

allegations.description: Double insurance coverage for Pristina Airport starting on 1 April 2004.
allegations.findings: Evidence of overlapping insurance policies was found, leading to financial losses.

findings: Failure to conduct a tendering process violates finance administration instructions.
Potential misappropriation of funds requires review by the Department of Justice.

violations.excerpt: Negligence in adhering to competitive tendering as per public procurement guidelines.

actions: Review the matter by the Department of Justice for legal violations.
Implement stricter controls and audits for future insurance procurements.
